alert.note: Alert for Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 11 at 10:45PM EDT until September 14 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of central and eastern Massachusetts, including the following counties, in central Massachusetts, Worcester. In eastern Massachusetts, Middlesex. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1042 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Between 3 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leominster, Fitchburg, Westford, Gardner, Holden, Clinton, Athol, Pepperell, Tyngsborough, Groton, Winchendon, Lunenburg, Townsend, Littleton, Lancaster, Templeton, Rutland, Sterling, Ayer and Westminster. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
